content.description: Climb 360 degrees around the building on the granite foundation.  More of an endurance boulder problem then anything technically difficult.
content.location: Thomas Hill, just off of Union Street.  It's the "highest" point in Bangor.

content.description: The first move is the crux.  This route is slightly different than most in the area due to it's somewhat challenging jump start.  There are cameras literally directly to the side of the top of climb, who knows who, or if anyone is watching them.  Wall kick up to the black pipe, easy climbing after the first couple moves.  Downclimb your way back to the Earth after enjoying watching people come and go from the front of the store.  Don't get spotted!!!
content.location: The route is on the back of the store.  Park somewhere in the parking lot and non suspiciously walk around to the back.  There will be a somewhat large yellow steel frame on the back of the building with a black pipe descending from the middle.  This seems to be located in roughly the same spot on all new Super Walmarts.

content.description: This route is on the left side of the building if you are outside looking towards the front.  Wall kick/jump start up to the metal beam laying across some pillars and then proceed to the intermediate roof.  From here, wall kick to the top, or improvise your way to the top using some partner techniques.  DOWNCLIMB.
content.location: The route is on Target in Bangor, which is off of Stillwater Ave.  from I95 exit 193 head west.  Turn right when you get to Stillwater and you will approach Target from it's rear.

content.description: Just like the other listed areas.  Cold in the winter...  Much more crowded than the other areas due to; well, more people.
